isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - INSTALL - Checking the Runout of the Ring Gear

svcproc.title: Checking the Runout of the Ring Gear

step1.para: Attach a dial indicator on the mounting flange of the carrier ( Figure 131).
Adjust the dial indicator so that the plunger is against the back surface of the ring gear ( Figure 131).

figure.caption: Figure 131. Attach and Adjust Dial Indicator

step1.para: Adjust the dial of the indicator to zero (0).
Rotate the differential and ring gear assembly while you read the dial indicator. The run-out of the ring gear must not exceed 0.008 inch (0.200 mm).
If the run-out of the ring gear exceeds specification, remove the differential and ring gear assembly from the carrier.
Check the differential parts, including the carrier, for the problem that caused the run-out of the ring gear to exceed specifications. Repair or replace parts.

note.para: A shock load failure will distort the differential case flange and transfer damage to the ring gear. In this case, the differential carrier must be discarded.

step1.para: After the parts are repaired or replaced, install the main differential case and ring gear assembly into the carrier.
Repeat the preload adjustment of the differential side bearings and check the runout of the ring gear.
